p.s: The Basisbasis of the American dreamDream is that everybody can achieve anything because hard work pays off.
It also contains liberty and the pursuit of happiness what goes hand in hand with the Declaration of Independence.
Walter feels betrayed by the American dreamDream because in his job working hard gives him no opportunities.
But there is still hope in the American dreamDream in his position.
By working hard and buying the liquor store he wants to reach prosperity and status that he how hardly earned.
In this way he especially as a black man can pay it back to the rich white men that treated him bad for so long.
He wants to be the proof that even as a black man you can achieve your dream.
It takes such a big role in his mind because all the oppression made him feel less worthy and destroyed his self confidence.
But he is shuresure that he will make it and revive his confidence and masculinity.
Sadly his dream may not be realizable because it is risky and also the racism could destroy his plans.
Beneatha has a dream that is kind of similar.
By becoming a female doctor, which was really rare back then, she wants to prove that you can achieve what you want no matter your background.
Since she is self confident and strong she is shuresure that she will make it with the financial support.

But that she is need of a paycheck that not everyone has it destroys the fairness of the American dreamDream because it does well matter if you grew up with money for your carreercareer opportunities.
Even without the wealth being a doctor offers the message and independence it gives Beneatha makes it so desireabledesirable.
For Mama and Ruth it is not the success and prosperity playing a key-role in their dream.
They both focus more of the pursuit of happiness, the american dreamAmerican Dream offers.
This doesn't come entirely because they are just modest but also because they have no faith in themselves beeingbeing able to become successful as black women.
They have accepted the role of beeingbeing disadvantaged in society but the American Dream still gives them hope because buying a house will still make them more happy and independent.
Also escaping the ghetto and going to an all white neighbourhood shows less oppression from society because they aren't forced to live in an overpriced flat with a shared bathroom.
All in all you could say that every family member holds on to the American dreamDream and hopes for a better life while sending a message for the white people's discrimination.
Sadly they depend on a paycheck for this and cantcan't fulfill the dreams with their own work which speaks Againstagainst the unity and endless possibilities for black and white people.
